project.description: Job exists on ecos0041. Can disable run here if needed.

hudson.tasks.Shell.command:
source /home/test/.bashrc #Set the below parameters manually package_name="python" published_version="2.7.14"
#Check distro and available version in repo : rhel7.x, Sles11.x/12.x, Ub16.x/17.x . /etc/os-release if [ $ID == "rhel" ]; then available_version=$(sudo yum info $package_name | grep Version | head -1 | cut -d ':' -f 2| cut -d ' ' -f 2) elif [ $ID == "sles" ]; then available_version=$(sudo zypper info $package_name | grep Version | head -1 | cut -d ':' -f 2| cut -d ' ' -f 2) elif [ $ID == "ubuntu" ]; then available_version=$(sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-cache policy $package_name | grep Candidate | head -1 | cut -d ' ' -f 4) fi
if [[ $available_version == *"$published_version"* ]]; then echo "Version $published_version is already available in repo" echo "Exact name: $available_version ... Failing" exit 1 else echo "Published version is not available in repo. Going ahead." fi
rm -rf ./* #Install dependencies sudo yum install -y gcc gcc-c++ make ncurses patch wget tar bzip2-devel zlib-devel xz xz-devel readline-devel sqlite-devel tk-devel ncurses-devel gdbm-devel openssl-devel libdb-devel gdb
#Get source wget https://www.python.org/ftp/python/2.7.14/Python-2.7.14.tar.xz tar -xvf Python-2.7.14.tar.xz cd Python-2.7.14
#Apply patch to fix test_regrtest wget https://github.com/python/cpython/pull/3912/commits/ab35adc682ec51800aa19a77de9947c6aaa50f41.diff cat ab35adc682ec51800aa19a77de9947c6aaa50f41.diff | patch -p1
#Build and test ./configure --prefix=/usr/local --exec-prefix=/usr/local make make test 2>&1 | tee testlog
#Store failed tests grep "test test.*failed" testlog | cut -d" " -f2-2 | uniq >failures
#Store tests expected to fail and intermittent tests echo "test_bz2" >expected
#Diff between expected and actual failures diff -u expected failures | tee diff_
#Fail if any extra test failed apart from expected if grep -q '+test' diff_; then exit 0 fi
#Run intermittent tests individually cd ./Lib/test ../../python -m unittest test_bz2
#Install cd ../../ sudo make install python -V
